name: function 1
Generate dummy data
Read me first
info:
In order to make this example works you have to do the following things:
---
Configure BAI
---
 - in Flink event-processor-config.yml enter:
    configurations:
        - kafka-topic: in-topic
          elasticsearch-index: in-topic
 - Call BAI mamagement service. For example:
        curl -i -k -u admin:passw0rd -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d @sampleiot-avro.json https://ibmbai:6898/api/v1/datasources/elasticsearch/config
    as defined in https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-biz-automation/20.0.x?topic=cce-event-forwarder
    where sampleiot-avro.json is like following:
        {"index":"in-topic","schemaName":"sampleiot-value","schema":{"name":"sampleiot","type":"record","namespace":"com.ibm.bai","fields":[{"name":"id","type":"string","logicalType":"UUID"},{"name":"timestamp","type":"string"},{"name":"category","type":"string"},{"name":"value","type":"int"}]}}


---
Configure Node-red
---
 - Add to Node-red setting.js under functionGlobalContext: the following line: avro:require("avro-js")
 - Install "node-red-dashboard" and "node-red-contrib-kafka-manager" in 'Manage palette\install'. You can use also different connectors.
 - Enter in a node "Enter your data here & Click" proper: 
    "avroSchema" - Avro schema for generated messages,
    "avroSchemaid" - Avro schema id from kafka schema registry, 
            (e.g. https://ibmbai:8084/subjects/sampleiot-value/versions/1)
    "message" â€“ A message corresponding to avro schema.
 - Configure Kafka Producer node:
    "Topic"=in-topic - your kafka topic name for custom messages 
    "Broker" - kafka broker configuration info
    "Hosts" =[ibmbai, 29092] - hostname and port number of kafka bootstrap server 
    "Use TLS" - configurinf TLS communication
        Use TLS/Private Key/Upload < - truststore.jks
        Use TLS/Passphrase < - from store-password.txt
        Use Credentials (SASL plain)/User < - eg. admin
        Use Credentials (SASL plain)/Password < - eg. passw0rd
 - Deploy a flow
 - To start flow click "Enter your data here & Click" node or enter http://localhost:1880/ui

name: Message parsing
Adding schemaId
func:
var schemaIdbuffer = Buffer.alloc(5); //allocating 5 bytes buffer
schemaIdbuffer.writeInt8(parseInt(msg.avroSchemaId),4) //  avro "avroSchemaid" from kafka schema registry
msg.payload =  Buffer.concat([schemaIdbuffer, msg.payload])
return msg;

name: Message generator
Read me first
info:
In order to make this example works you have to do the following things:
---
Configure BAI
---
 - in Flink event-processor-config.yml enter:
    configurations:
        - kafka-topic: in-topic
          elasticsearch-index: in-topic
 - Call BAI mamagement service. For example:
        curl -i -k -u admin:passw0rd -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d @sampleiot-avro.json https://ibmbai:6898/api/v1/datasources/elasticsearch/config
    as defined in https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-biz-automation/20.0.x?topic=cce-event-forwarder
    where sampleiot-avro.json is like following:
        {"index":"in-topic","schemaName":"sampleiot-value","schema":{"name":"sampleiot","type":"record","namespace":"com.ibm.bai","fields":[{"name":"id","type":"string","logicalType":"UUID"},{"name":"timestamp","type":"string"},{"name":"category","type":"string"},{"name":"value","type":"int"}]}}


---
Configure Node-red
---
 - Add to Node-red setting.js under functionGlobalContext: the following line: avro:require("avro-js")
 - Install "node-red-dashboard" and "node-red-contrib-kafka-manager" in 'Manage palette\install'. You can use also different connectors.
 - Enter in a node "Enter your data here & Click" proper: 
    "iterations" - How many iterations every 4 hours,
    "cycles" - How many cycles per every iteration,
    "startDate" - Date from which data will be generated,
    "avroSchema" - Avro schema for generated messages,
    "avroSchemaid" - Avro schema id from kafka schema registry, 
            (e.g. https://ibmbai:8084/subjects/sampleiot-value/versions/1)
 - Do not change "i", "j" and "stop" parameters unless you do know what you do
 - Configure Kafka Producer node:
    "Topic"=in-topic - your kafka topic name for custom messages 
    "Broker" - kafka broker configuration info
    "Hosts" =[ibmbai, 29092] - hostname and port number of kafka bootstrap server 
    "Use TLS" - configurinf TLS communication
        Use TLS/Private Key/Upload < - truststore.jks
        Use TLS/Passphrase < - from store-password.txt
        Use Credentials (SASL plain)/User < - eg. admin
        Use Credentials (SASL plain)/Password < - eg. passw0rd
 - Deploy a flow
 - To start the flow click "Enter your data here & Click" node or enter http://localhost:1880/ui
 - To stop the flow clic "Stop" node



 -
